article_title: Netanyahu asks 'forgiveness' over hostage deaths as protests continue
sentence: Benjamin  Netanyahu  has  asked  for  "forgiveness"  from  Israelis  for  failing  to  return  six  hostages  found  dead  in  Gaza  on  Saturday,  as  Hamas  warned  more  could  be  "returned  to  their  families  in  shrouds"  if  a  ceasefire  isn't  reached.

article_title: Netanyahu asks 'forgiveness' over hostage deaths as protests continue
sentence: US,  Egyptian  and  Qatari  mediators  are  trying  to  broker  a  ceasefire  deal  that  would  see  Hamas  release  the  97  hostages  still  being  held,  including  33  who  are  presumed  dead,  in  exchange  for  Palestinian  prisoners  in  Israeli  jails.

article_title: Netanyahu asks 'forgiveness' over hostage deaths as protests continue
sentence: Meanwhile,  funeral  services  for  some  of  the  hostages  killed  on  Saturday  have  been  held.

article_title: Netanyahu asks 'forgiveness' over hostage deaths as protests continue
sentence: The  Israeli  military  launched  a  campaign  in  Gaza  to  destroy  Hamas  in  response  to  the  unprecedented  attack  on  southern  Israel  on  7  October,  during  which  about  1,200  people  were  killed  and  251  others  were  taken  hostage.

article_title: Netanyahu asks 'forgiveness' over hostage deaths as protests continue
sentence: More  than  40,000  people  have  been  killed  in  Gaza  since  then,  according  to  the  territory's  Hamas-run  health  ministry.
